companyDetails: Disruptive Mapping Platform made in France.  **Main Clients**: SNCF, OVH, OpenDataSoft, Mon Docteur, LibertyRider, RATP...

description.label: Architect and Developer of the distributed Mapping Platform
description.details:
The 'Mapsquare' project codename was released under the brand **Jawg** (Jawg maps). I was the first developer of the platform.  
My main role was to create a distributed ecosystem of micro services for our Mapping Platform. Storage API (GIS allowing to manipulate and manage datasets), Tile-edge (a highly efficient Map Server), Static Maps API, authentication system, and the administration section.

description.label: Management of Clustering / Data Import SDK / Geo-Caching
description.details:
In order to be highly efficient, GIS need to implement specific features such as multi-threaded Geocaching, Meta-Tile awareness, Server-side clustering, and multi-layer clustering.  
Also, managing datasets often requires to import heterogeneous Data from different providers. I was in charge to create the API for a Data Import SDK targeting on-premises versions of the platform for some of our customers. This allowed to handle tricky cases such as transaction rollback, data deduplication (both semantical and geographical), and conflict resolution.

description.label: Development of a conference driving mobile application (Android >= 4.0)
description.details:
This project had two challenges:
  • How can we use the tablets/phones's ergonomy to our advantage to make a conference more dynamic for students?
  • What tools can we give the showman/teacher so he could get closer to his audience, communicate further with them, push multimedia contents to the clients and get live feedback from them?

description.label: Adaptation of an open data database model (GTFS) for train schedules to be used on an embedded SQLite database
description.details:
The concept was to identify which info was relevant, and change the original use case scenario; then build a conversion model with a hybrid Java/SQL migration program.
In the end, the embedded database is about 1/290 of the original size
